metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0431 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In kbd_keycode of keyboard.c, there is a possible out of bounds write dueto a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilegewith no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-144161459

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0431` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-lowlatency - 5.4.0-18.22
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.6.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1007-raspi - 5.4.0-1007.7
No subscription required
